title: Unobtainable Skins and the creative slot they hold hostage
body:
I think that the limited skins should get an update and be released again, but before you get an grump ear me out. I'm not saying they should make exact copies of some of the older skins, it's just that some of them occupy an extremely cool theme that a champ can display but will never have except for the ones who were lucky enough to be OG. I think they should reimagine some of those skins and release them to the public, maybe release similarly styled skins that are throwbacks to those old skins, like pax tf, pax jax, pax sivir and riot singed. You know a jax that has the same weapon and hat but a different style of outfit, (imo) pax tf is kinda lame I don't really see his theme translating into anything else, but pax sivir is basically a project sivir skin, and riot singed is basically just a modern singed, but these champ themes are locked away, I'm not saying that they should be released and screw their old fans I'm just saying I want a jax skin 
that has a conical hat and bo :) and a singed skin that gives him a modern Frontline suppression unit theme. 
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}




Edit: pax Jax has a cardboard tube, so maybe instead of that give him a tree branch, wooden table 
leg, something like that. Just to be clear these wouldn't be replicas, they would be unique skins that copy some similar themes, for example Jax has a conical hat with a ornament on it and a different color scheme, singed gets updated riot gear which is different to the original, thanks like that, not gigantic changes, but enough to make them unique and also occupy a SIMILAR theme, that way you 
can enjoy those styles of the champion without ruining the authenticity of the originals. It would devalue the originals, but they have no value except the exclusivity, they would still be exclusive and people would still go wow, it's just that they have cool concepts that got locked away.

replies.body:
But skins like these are limited for a reason? It's supposed to show that someone attended an event, bought the skin during the first few years of league, won a tournament etc etc.

Their purpose isn't to look cool and be bought by everyone, it's to show that the player had to go to great lengths to get that skin.

A lot of the skins didn't require great effort to get though, it was just be at the right place at the right time.

Both Championship Riven and Urf the Manatee were just available in the shop, and if you started league after that, then you're out of luck. 

Champ Riven was available when I first started league, and I didn't buy it of course, because at lvl 5 I didn't realise the significance of it, and now I have to deal with some shitty ass version with 2016 slapped on the end of its name. Even through I was "At" the event at the time. 

And the skins that did require you to go to Pax or other events are far far worse...

So Im forbidden from getting a skin, because I don't have enough money for a plane ticket to another country, and enough time away from work/uni to take a week off and go to some obscure gaming event overseas? 
Serves me right! 

You see what i mean? Its hardly fair.

Eh sorry Sesshy but PAX isn't obscure in any sense.

It's arguably the biggest gaming and nerd culture expo in the world, to the point that it has spread across the world with PAX Aus and PAX EU, and is even advertised on TV and talked about openly on talk shows.

Thats true, but It's obscure and unnecessary to your Tutors and Boss, when you have to ask for a week off Work/Uni to fly to Aussie for it. :P

hence no skins for me :(

Well the PAX series of skins were never available at PAX Aus because they were canceled before PAX Aus was a thing, so that point is quite moot.

But as my other post said, the PAX line has been replaced with the far more accessible ARCADE line.

Well I've never had the luxury of having enough money or time to go to Aussie Pax, or any other kind of Pax, so either way I was unable to obtain the skins. _(The real point is: Should I be disadvantaged, just because I live half the world away, and cant access Pax as easily as the people who live in the city that it's held in?)_

Thats true, I definitely are with you! Arcade skins are awesome, and they are a great substitute for Pax skins! However, they don't make the existing Pax skins any less unavailable.

The point with the PAX skins is that they were a reward at the time.
6 years ago PAX was actually obscure still, and the LoL community was small and just getting started, we needed things like the PAX skins to generate hype, get people banding together as a community.

And really you don't want them.
If I go into a game with my PAX Sivir I get five man ganked under tower at level 3.
And the jungle invades when I play PAX Jax.
Uhg,

Thats a shame about being ganked just cos you have a skin :(
Another reason why re-selling the skins would be a good thing though ;)

My main annoyance is that awesomely themed skins like Pax Svir _(come on, who doesn't like Tron)_ just never get seen, there simply aren't enough people who have it.

It's how the gaming industry works though.

There are very few of us who have the Pip-boy Edition of Fallout4.
Or the bust of Duke Nukem.
An M3 Predator replica from Mass Effect. (seriously difficult to get a display stand/case for that by the way)

People assumed that Championship Riven would never make a return, but Riot never actually said that.

There are very few skins they have said would never return, King Rammus, Black Alistar, Silver and Judgement Kayle, the PAX series, Riot Singed. (though Riot Singed doesn't make sense since you have other Riot skins)

Think of the backlash that Digital Extremes would encounter if they brought back Excalibur Prime, they didn't even do that when they made the China version of the game, they made instead Excalibur Prime Umbra, because at the same time as having promised they'd never bring back Excalibur Prime, they had to have something for the opening of the Chinese version of the game.

Riot haven't even allowed sale of old limited skins during the opening of a new server.

I do see what you're saying, and it makes a lot of sense, and Im not saying its not how it works, I'm saying it isn't fair to the majority of the population. 

It's understandable to have limited numbers of physical objects like the Pip-boy and busts, _(the same way Rolex watches and Bugatti have limited editions.)_ Because it takes machinery and manpower to create those objects, machinery and manpower that becomes less and less money-efficient once the release hype has worn off. So because of real-world restraints _(e.g. Creating and distributing a Pip-Boy to every single fall-out player, would make the game a catastrophic money drain for the companies involved.)_ it's understandable that physical objects would be limited and only return on special occasions _(if at all)_. 

But when your 'limited edition' is a line of computer code...
(that technically is already sitting in our computers taking up space) and the only reason we don't have it is because someone hasn't flicked a switch. Well.. thats just a little pathetic. 
Its false limited, not truly limited. 

______

I don't know much about Excalibur Prime, but my biggest beef is with Nintendo and Pokemon for this though. 

there have been 24 Pokemon games over the last 20 years _(including the classics we all know and love)_. 
Mew, one of the oldest, most iconic, and most loved _(ranked 3rd favourite (out of now 802) in Japan last year)_ Pokemon _(and my personal favourite)_, has never, repeat never, been available to catch, in any game...

24 games... 20 years... No Mew. Ever.

The only way to legally obtain one is to receive a gift from Nintendo, and only in certain events. Most of which of course, exclusively in Japan _(far from here! too far to warrant a trip just to get an 8 bit digital animal.)_. 

They give out Mew for free, (you've never had to pay for it), so they make little money off it. 
Almost everyone In our generation grew up with Pokemon, and sat as kids watching the epic battle between Mew and Mewtwo, so everyone wants it, because its a piece of their childhood. 

There is actually no reason to withhold the Pokemon from the game. They cant make much money off printing thousands of codes and giving them out for free, and all it does is make people unlucky enough not to have a several thousand dollar trip to japan, hack the game and distribute illegal copies of it _(which helps no one, especially not Nintendo.)_

I know its only Pokemon and not fancy e-sports games like League or Overwatch.
But it doesn't matter what the game is, It's this pointless withholding of content that pisses me off.

_____

Eventually, most _(if not all)_ of the people who own the Pax skins etc etc, Won't even be playing anymore _(or slowly, more and more accounts get banned for various reasons_), and soon enough the skins will essentially be extinct from the game, and Riot will probably have to bring them back anyway.
So theres little point in pretending that they will be 'limited' forever, and if you know they're not going to be limited forever, then why not just bring them back already?

PS. Nice job on getting those collectibles though! :P 
My brother is pretty annoyed that he couldn't afford the Pip-Boy. 
Apparently people are 3D printing them now though?

Eh I don't much understand the salt on the Mew issue, the Wifi/Internet events happen quite regularly, and two years ago there was one that gave out Mew for free internationally and that event went for just over a month.
You just connect to Mystery Gift via the internet and bob's your uncle.

-------------------------
If you really want one...
https://www.twitch.tv/pokemoncenter
These guys occasionally do give aways and let you "order" a pokemon from them.
--------------------------

And you'd be surprised, there actually is quite the E-Sport following for Pokemon, especially because it can have just as, if not more strategy and skill involved than LoL at some points.


---------------------------------------

Personally I accept Digital Exclusive items fairly easily, it might have something to do with the YEARS I poured into TF2 and it's micro transactions, to which I now have quite the collection of Unusual Hats.
(You can never have enough by the way)

I also see it as really the only option companies will have soon for generating hype and revenue.
People bitch about pre-order incentives, but what else are game devs meant to do?
The price of games hasn't changed in over 30 years, not even for inflation.
It's getting more and more expensive to make games, Devs need extra cash.

Digital hype generating exclusives create this. (to be fair though the PAX skins were free, you could never buy them, unless you went to a code seller online, but that's a rabbit hole)
Whether it be skins, bonus unlocks, Javick in ME3.

This is especially needed since more and more people are moving away from physical copies of games, even here in Australia where our internet is shit and is just getting worse because our government is run by corrupt retards who don't even know what a calculator is because an abacus suits them just fine as the pinnacle of technology.

And you have the moronic "don't pre-order" crowd, who believe pre-order incentives are ruining the industry, when what's actually ruining the industry is the fear of change, and new IPs, while people are at the same time barking for change and new IPs just so they can bitch that they aren't COD or whatever.


___________________

And yeah, basically a couple of people put together a digital scan of their Pip-boys and tidied up the model a bit.
You can download the plans to print your own Pip-boy just about anywhere.
Though really the same can be said for just about any collectible you want.

Oh, no I do have Mew! 
thanks for the link though!
When I saw the EB games event i went into several shops to get codes. 
Im just mad that theres no other way of getting it, except at the beck and call of Nintendo, especially seeming its such an Iconic Pokemon. 
Its like if Yasuo was only given out whenever Riot wanted, so you have to go to events to receive Yasuo. Its hardly fair to people who like Yasuo, and there'd be a ton of people who unknowingly miss out. 

There are some people who want to just play the game, and don't want to have to jump through hoops just to get a Pokemon that was made 20 years ago. They give you a Pokedex in the game and tell you to catch every Pokemon, then they say: 
"Ohhh but Pokemon like Celebi and Mew, you cant actually get, even though you need them for the Pokedex... sorry about that, wait a couple of years from now until your game is outdated, and we might think about giving it out."
And now they have stopped giving codes out for older games altogether. So if youre taking a trip down memory lane and playing one of the classics like Red or Blue, or even one of the remakes like Soulsilver and Heartgold _(arguably one of the best releases of pokemon)_ its physically impossible to get Mew or Celebi or a whole trove of other pokemon. 

I have a beef with games that wont let you finish them because theres something being withheld. Assassins creed 2 for example _(brilliant game)_, I spent so long doing all the little side missions, and collections, trying to get 100% synchronisation. Only to find that 3 of the 100 feathers you need to collect for one mission, are only available in the exclusive pre-release edition of the game. So unless you pre-ordered the game, its **literally** impossible to finish it...

Yea I know that Pokemon gets quite competitive and remarkably strategic, Ive got a nice Milotic that my team centres around (I'm not competitive in it though, even though my team would probably do alright, i just battle for fun :P). But its hardly to the same scale as Worlds in league. 


______

Thats fair enough haha, and like Aurelion Sol says "Hats are _always_ fashionable!" ;)

As for Pre-order incentives, the majority of people who pre-order the game, will pre-order it anyway, regardless of giveaways. And early access to the game and upcoming releases within it, is always a good incentive that gives pre-order players some specialty without disadvantaging normal buyers.
Things like Statues and physical object are cool too, it gives hardcore gamers something rare to collect, without giving them a special OP sword or something in-game, that some new player will see a year or two later and be upset because they can never have it. 

**My view is:** No matter when or where you buy a game, the actual content of the game (minus DLC's), should always be the exact same version as someone else. 
So you're free to give away whatever you want as a pre-order, as long an in game everyone is equal. 

Nothing is worse than buying a game a year or two after its release, getting really into it, and then realising that theres all this awesome stuff you can't get because you weren't into the game when it was released. 

_______

Thats kinda impressive that they have done that with the Pip-Boy tbh. 
Quite clever.

Oh I probably should also mention that you can get Mew at any time if you go through the long process of doing the Mew encounter glitch in Red/Blue/Yellow.
It's even easier now since Red and Blue are on the Nintendo EShop and are Pokebank compatible.

Believe me I tried that glitch as soon as the original games became available to buy on the Eshop ;)

but unfortunately the Mew (or Mews, you can get at least 2) that are obtained in Red/Blue/Yellow, can't be transferred through the Pokebank :(
so you're stuck with an illegal mew in a game that you cant do anything with. 

Nintendo cockblocks us again :/

This is the problem, you say "Earned", but Pax skins aren't earned, you get them because you happened to live near a city that hosted an event. Its not fair to people who live in NZ or the islands, or other out of the way countries, who will NEVER have an event, and are too far away from the event to travel. So having skins that can only be obtained by being in the right place at the right time, are not fair at all. 

If you do the maths, there are millions of league players. So many, that all of them could never ever fit into one event. Therefore theoretically even if all the league players in the world DID manage to go to the event to try and get a skin, most of them would still miss out. Hardly fair. 

I agree that Triumphant Ryze, and earned skins like that (Until recently, Medieval twitch and Grey Warwick, too) shouldn't go on sale, because they are earned.

The difference between Triumphant Ryze, and the Pax skins, is that Ryze is always ABLE to be obtained, yes its hard to get and you have to earn it, but theres not a time frame. Its a limited skin, but it still allows anyone to try and get it if they are able. 

Where as Pax skins are like "Oh, you live in New York? heres a free skin for being in the centre of the world!"

Because if they really did say "Oh let's just give it to everyone in the general area of the event", than I must say, that is total bullshit.

Oh, yea Im sure you had to have a ticket or receive a giveaway card or something, for sure.

What i mean is, how far are you willing to travel to go to Pax to get that card?

If you live in the city it's hosted in, then its piss easy for you to go, and Pax TF is yours easy as pie. Maybe if you live in America, you'll drive across the state to go to Pax? Possibly 2 states for the committed?  Maybe catch a plane across the country if you're REALLY into computer games, and need to be there. 

But can you justify flying to America (Or wherever else Pax was held) from another country, to go to Pax?

How do people from England get their Pax Sivir?
How do people living in some Samoan village get their chance to get Pax Jax?

Disadvantaging people in an _online_ game, because of their geographical location, is what's bullshit.  No one from some back country town in the south island of New Zealand is going to buy a Pax ticket just to get Twisted Fate, when they know full well they'll never be able to go to the event. 

So saying _"Sorry guys, you didn't go to the event, so you'll never own this cool skin!"_ is horrible, because as much as some people wanted to go, its just not possible for a great many of them. 

There will be die hard Twisted Fate mains out there that couldn't go to Pax because they live in some obscure place like Turkmenistan or something, that has never had a gaming event and probably will never have one.
Meanwhile random people living in the general area of the city that hosts Pax, _(who may not even make it to lvl 30 before going back to CoD)_ get 2 or 3 copies, just becasue they live in a country that's the 'centre of the world'.

Agreed!

Most of my posts end this way xD

I personally think that there should never be any limited skins.

The only reason for having a 'limited' skin, is to show:
_"Im better than you because I have something valuable, and you'll **never** have it!"_
and is that really the attitude you want In league?

Its fine to have limited things when they are real _(you can only make so many Ferrari's or Rolexes before you run out of materials)_ but when the 'limited' item is a string of computer code.  Its exclusion for the sake of it. 

They brought back Championship Riven, they've already shown that they can bring it back if they want, which means that all of the rest of the skins lose their credibility as 'limited', because theres always that nagging possibility they they'll come back as well, whenever someone at Riot chooses. So seeming all the limited skins have already lost their credibility as being limited, its time to just bite the bullet, and bring them back, give 90% of the population what they want. 

Then the people at Riot can trade their 'limited' computer code in, for real limited Ferrari's and Rolexes. 

I do think that its incredibly selfish for such cool concepts like Riot Singed, and Urf the Manatee, to be basically absent from the game, just so a few people _(who often don't even play the skins)_ can feel 'special'.
Hi, do you own any of these skins?

Making something limited creates a demand for it however.
Supply and demand make things more wanted.
Take a look at amiibos for instance, artificial supply limits make them crazy hot to sell, not to mention it's nigh impossible to get officially licensed Nintendo figurines outside of Japan, or third party craftsmen.

Not to mention that some of these skins are limited for a reason as they were rewards for certain things.

For instance I would be pissed if people could suddenly get Silver Kayle a skin that was a reward for BUYING THE PHYSICAL EDITION OF THE GAME.
Do you own those original skins?
Yes, I have Silver Kayle, PAX Sivir and PAX Jax.

Makes sense you so vehemently defend the quality and limit nature of the skins. Im not saying thats a bad thing, and i certainly believe they shouldnt rerelease silver kayle or black alistar. Whether or not they a re good or bad quality. Those were preorders you expect them to have their own status above other limited skins.

But wouldnt you like to get a twisted fate skin that had similar references, im not saying releas the same skin, but maybe make a new one with updated references and a new overall theme. Wouldnt you like that type of thing? Say if u were a tf main who enjoyed those references made by the original skin, but couldnt get it because they werent in the right place at the right time. It woulnt be the exct same skin but it would satisfy the newer players without ruining the limited status of the originals. Plus as a bonus they would probably update those old skins at the same time to appease their old fans, its a win-win, your skin gets updated and we get a homage to the birth of one of the most popular games out there and popular references of those years.

You do realise that PAX Jax doesn't have a bo.
That is a cardboard tube.
The skin is based off of the Cardboard Sammurai from Penny Arcade's comics. (PAX = Penny Arcade Expo)

And no, this is a horrible idea.
It would outright depreciate the value and effort put into these old skins.

Let's go take a look at Alistar's visual update.
That turned Black Alistar into more than a recolour and a quite fine skin.
It was a reward for pre-ordering a physical copy of the game.
There are people who still play the game from back then, and it would be quite the dick punch to release a skin that is similar.

Same for Silver Kayle, that skin was released for those who bought the physical copy of the game.
I know I wouldn't appreciate it if the skin was released again.
However it's design does allow it to be re-released in the same manor that Champ Riven was re-released.
But that's subject to change upon Kayle's inevitable visual rework.

As for the PAX Skins they speak for themselves.
Each one is a reference to multiple gaming and pop culture icons.
Creating a re-release version would depreciate the value of these skins, and I don't mean monetarily.
If these characters get Visual Updates, and new voice lines, these skins will also be updated, and it sets the table for these skins to get updated references on top of their existing visual ones.
Such as PAX TF's overall theme being a reference to just about every trading card game from Magic to Yugioh.
PAX Sivir referencing Tron and other 1900's scifi films.


-------------------------------------------------------------------

EDIT: It's notable that the PAX skin line has been replaced with the ARCADE skin line, which is far more accessible.
It doesn't require you to attend an event, but the skins are given away for free at events.
Their gaming and pop culture references are also less obscure.

You may be missing the point, what creative idea does silver kayle and black alistar actually hold? They are basically chromas. There are much more interesting and unique skin designs. The point isn't to release the old skins again, it's to use similar themes to create entirely (or mostly) new skins. Black alistar and silver kyle lack their own individuality. Tbh, I would be kinda passed if I bought this game, stuck with it for its lifetime and my skin becomes shifty and outdated compared to all the other ones, maybe they could give those old skins some new particle effects make them into actually good quality skins.

Have you seen Black Alistar since he got his Visual Update?
It's now greatly considered his best skin.

Silver Kayle will be the same when she gets her VU.

I have seen it, other than the limited factor it's fairly uninteresting, give infernal ali or skt1 ali any day of the week. Those skins are more detailed, interesting and give the champ a new identity, flaming cow and sport mascot vs different color scheme and a ginger hairdo. Btw, majority does nothat dictate other people's opinion. Mine is that black alistar is an uninteresting skin, not bad, just uninteresting, it's good quality, I would just say it doesn't beat his other skins.
the only one id wan't is ufo corki the rest are pretty garbage.

sounds like a dumb idea tbh.
even if they're not the exact same it still takes away from the value of the originals.
